tournament.name: Duel Commander Mensal - 11/06 - Academia de Jogos

decks.notes: The key concept of this deck is to aggressively attack the opponent with efficient and powerful creatures and burn spells. It aims to apply constant pressure while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Price of Progress and Blood Moon. The deck uses cards like Goblin Rabblemaster and Hellrider to overwhelm the opponent with hasty creatures and direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt and Fireblast to finish off the opponent quickly. The deck also includes cards like Sulfuric Vortex and Eidolon of the Great Revel to punish opponents for playing non-creature spells. Overall, the strategy is to be aggressive, apply pressure, and finish off the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

The focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of countermagic, card draw, and extra turns. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by countering their spells and bouncing their threats back to their hand. It utilizes Jace, Vryn's Prodigy as the commander to recur instants and sorceries from the graveyard, providing additional card advantage. The inclusion of powerful interaction spells such as Force of Will, Cryptic Command, and Cyclonic Rift allows the deck to maintain control of the board and outvalue the opponent. With access to extra turn spells like Time Warp and Temporal Mastery, the deck can close out the game by getting ahead on both mana and cards.

The deck focuses on building a fast and aggressive board presence using Anafenza, the Foremost as the commander. It includes a mix of efficient creatures, removal spells, and disruptive cards to control the game while applying pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy, control the board, and close out the game quickly with powerful creatures and equipment. It utilizes a combination of mana acceleration, hand disruption, and versatile creatures to maintain a proactive game plan and stay ahead of the opponent. The strategy revolves around efficiently using resources and applying constant pressure to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory in a Duel Commander 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on utilizing an aggro strategy to overwhelm opponents with efficient creatures and disruptive spells. By incorporating cards that generate mana quickly, such as Birds of Paradise and Noble Hierarch, the deck aims to ramp up quickly and play powerful threats like Jenara, Asura of War. In addition, the deck includes a variety of versatile spells like Counterspell and Swords to Plowshares to control the board and protect its creatures. The inclusion of cards like Birthing Pod and Fauna Shaman also allows for flexibility in finding key creatures to further pressure opponents. Overall, the deck aims to maintain a proactive game plan and apply consistent pressure to secure a victory.

The main idea of the deck is to control the game by using a combination of spells, artifacts, and lands to disrupt your opponent's strategy while building up resources and eventually overwhelming them with powerful creatures and planeswalkers. It focuses on ramping up mana quickly to cast high-cost spells like Maelstrom Wanderer and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, while also utilizing extra turn effects and board wipes to maintain control of the battlefield. The deck employs a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage engines to outvalue opponents and ensure victory through a combination of tempo and inevitability.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through countering spells, removing threats, and card advantage, while ultimately winning through powerful planeswalker abilities and extra turn spells. Narset, Enlightened Master is the commander who allows players to cast spells off the top of their library without paying their mana cost, providing a huge advantage. The deck includes a wide range of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw spells to control the board and keep opponents in check. The planeswalkers in the deck provide additional value and versatile abilities to help close out the game. Extra turn spells are included to give the player additional opportunities to make game-winning plays and outmaneuver opponents.

The deck focuses on ramping up quickly to get to its big threats and overwhelming the opponent with its powerful creatures and spells. It aims to control the game by managing the board through removal and disruption while consistently accelerating its mana to cast impactful spells like Tooth and Nail, The Great Aurora, and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. Nissa, Vastwood Seer helps with card advantage and eventually transforms into a powerful planeswalker. The deck utilizes a variety of mana dorks, land tutors, and high-value creatures like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn to pressure the opponent and close out the game. It aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent in a long game of attrition.

This deck focuses on utilizing Teferi, Temporal Archmage to generate extra turns through various combo pieces and control elements. The goal is to disrupt opponents' strategies with counterspells like Force of Will and Cryptic Command, while also locking them down with cards like Stasis and Winter Orb. By ramping up mana production with High Tide and artifacts like Basalt Monolith, the deck aims to cast powerful sorceries like Time Stretch and Time Warp to take multiple consecutive turns and overwhelm the opponent. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Tolaria West to search for key pieces like Boseiju, Who Shelters All for protection. Overall, this deck aims to control the game tempo and win through extra turn spells and powerful support cards.
